history.content: No, you can only apply to one graduate program at Berkeley per year. (https://grad.berkeley.edu/admissions/apply/)

children.subject: Can you elaborate on this while still preserving anonymity (if that's a concern?)

So I was in a similar situation to what I'm assuming the OP is trying to hedge against--applied to the PhD program and got turned down, and wanted to use the 5th year program as a backup, but wasn't able to apply due to the aforementioned official policy.  Some time after the application deadline had passed, I happened to mention this in passing to the professor I probably would have worked with, and he said that he probably could have gotten the staff to make an exception if he had known about it earlier.  (But of course I don't know if that actually would have worked, since I didn't get the opportunity to try it.)

The tl;dr is mostly that I would encourage the OP (or anyone who gets into a situation like mine) to talk to a professor earlier to try to see if an exception can be made--but also it's probably best to avoid getting into this jam in the first place if you can avoid it.

(And re: anonymity, it's mostly just a stylistic thing because I can't fully guarantee the veracity of the information I'm providing, and I think that's a little more clear if it's from an anonymous post as opposed to one with someone's name attached to it.)

The official policy is that you cannot apply to both (as the student answer says).

However, I have heard (unofficially) that if the professor you would be working with asks really nicely, they may make exceptions.  Though I would not recommend relying on that, as I cannot guarantee that it will always (or even sometimes) work.

history.content: hi all, is it possible to apply for Berkeley phds first this fall and if i get rejected, apply for 5th year master's regular decision next spring? Thanks
history.subject: Applying for both PhDs and 5th year Masters
